intro: Amsonia tabernaemontana, commonly known as blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its striking blue-gray foliage and clusters of pale blue to white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and it produces small, tubular flowers that are pollinated by insects. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for native gardens. The plant is also known for its ability to attract pollinators and its ornamental value in landscaping.
